en_US.help_kwiss_del: Deletes a user from the ladder
en_US.help_kwiss_info: Takes regular kwiss arguments and spits out info about it, idk
en_US.desc_kwiss:
Starts a kwiss.

Optional arguments to start a kwiss (in any order):
  mode - Game mode. "points" or "rush".
  category - one out of !kwiss category
  difficulty - any, easy, medium or hard
  question count - number that determines how many questions are to be posed
  ranked - include this to start a ranked kwiss
  gecki - Gecki participates (only works in points mode)

Example: !kwiss 5 tv hard gecki

Points game mode: Each question is answered by all players. The players earn points depending on how many questions they answered correctly. The player who earned the most points wins.

Rush game mode: The player who is the fastest to answer correctly wins the question. The player who answers the most questions correctly wins.

Ranked: To start a kwiss that counts for the eternal global ladder, use the argument "ranked". Ranked kwisses are constrained in most kwiss parameters (especially mode and difficulty).
en_US.desc_kwiss_status: Displays info about the currently running kwiss (if there is any).
en_US.desc_kwiss_score: Shows the score of the currently running kwiss (if there is any).
en_US.desc_kwiss_stop: Stops the currently running kwiss (if there is any). Only the original requester of the kwiss and mods can stop a kwiss. If a ranked kwiss is stopped, no points are submitted to the ladder.
en_US.desc_kwiss_del: Deletes a user from the ladder.
en_US.desc_kwiss_question: Displays technical information about the current question, such as category, API source etc.
en_US.desc_kwiss_categories: Lists all available categories and the respective argument that is to be used to start a kwiss.
en_US.desc_kwiss_emoji: Sets an emoji as your personal prefix. Every time your name is used in a kwiss context, it is preceded by this emoji. Leave <emoji> blank to delete your emoji.
en_US.desc_kwiss_info: Takes regular kwiss arguments and spits out info about it, idk

de_DE.desc_kwiss:
Startet ein Kwiss.

Optionale Argumente (in beliebiger Reihenfolge):
  mode - Spielmodus. "points" oder "rush".
  category - eine aus !kwiss category
  difficulty - any, easy, medium oder hard
  question count - Zahl, die angibt, wieviele Fragen gestellt werden
  ranked - Kwiss z√§hlt f√ºr die Rangliste
  gecki - Gecki spielt mit (funktioniert nur im points-Modus)

Beispiel: !kwiss 5 tv hard gecki

Spielmodus "points": Jede Frage wird von allen Spielern beantwortet. Die Spieler bekommen Punkte abh√§ngig davon, wieviele Fragen sie korrekt beantwortet haben. Es gewinnt, wer die meisten Punkte hat.

Spielmodus "rush": Wer als erster korrekt antwortet, gewinnt die Frage. Wer die meisten Fragen gewinnt, gewinnt das Kwiss.

Ranked: Um ein Kwiss zu starten, das f√ºr die Rangliste z√§hlt, nutze das Argument "ranked". Ranked kwisses sind in den meisten Optione beschr√§nkt, insb. Spielmodus und Schwierigkeitsgrad.
